reviewText: This is a big legs workout. It has a lot of squats and lunges. I wish it was purely cardio. He has weightlifting in here too which makes it hard to alternate days between cardio and strength training. It is a great overall workout. I would suggest this DVD to anyone that wants a good workout just be careful with overtraining if you alternate strength and cardio.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The workout itself was excellent.  Bob knows exactly what he's doing to vary your heart rate from moderate to high level.  Just when you think you can't push any longer, he gives you a bit of a "break," before boosting you up again.  There is a lot of jumping in this workout, which I love, but it may be hard for some people.  There are a lot of lunges and squats, with jumping variations, as well as some upper body strength work.  When you think you've gotten to the end and you think Bob will return to his normal calm, yoga-loving self, he pushes you even harder.  This is definitely one of the most intense workouts I've done.The studio was different in this workout.  To me it appeared that they were exercising on some kind of spaceship.  It was a little strange at first, but to me what is most important is the quality of the workout.  I also prefer the covers of his Inside Out series, but these are nitpicky things.  The workout was OUTSTANDING.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love this DVD, makes me puff so much and at the end of it I feel like I have had an awesome workout. I like Bob's style he lets you go at your pace, there is no rushing which I sometimes find hard in other DVDs, makes me lose my form. I love that there is not much plank, not because I can't do it but because I have carpal tunnel syndrome and it hurts my wrists too much. Some of the weighted moves also hurt them but I just use lighter weights when it does. During some of the poses when he gets you to hold them I am shaking so much I almost fall over, fantastic!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This workout was really tough. I took a two week break off from working out mainly from being lazy (lol) and this workout had my heart beating so fast. I couldn't finish the entire workout (made it through 40 minutes) but that's fine because I know the next I do it I'll be able to get further. I had to take a couple of breaks in between for water but man I felt really good afterwards. Bob doesn't play any games. If you want a kick butt, tough (not much fun) no nonsense workout, this is it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've been working out with Bob's "Inside Out" 1 hour workout for a while now, so when I heard about this I put it on pre-order. There's a LOT of difference in this new DVD-a very high-tech, almost hospital-like set, more plyo/lunges (I admit due to wobbly creaky knees I generally just do runs in place or an alternate move instead), and some different weight moves. Still, it's Bob, and it's not a candy-butt routine by any stretch. I especially like the tricep kickbacks and overhead presses-keeps the middle-aged batwing flappiness at bay! I would definitely recommend this for advanced exercisers, NOT for beginners! I plan on doing this alternately with Bob's Inside Out one.
summary: Behold the power of the socks!

During this workout alone, I burned almost 500 calories in 61 minutes! Incredible, fantastic, challenging workout.

reviewText: I love thid DVD as any of the DVDs from Bob Harper. In a slow and steady pace he will give you a nice workout. I love the fact that he never stops for a second from one exercise to the next!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I admit, I never heard of Bob Harper a year ago.  He has now become my favorite dvd trainer! I love how he pushes you to the edge, where you think you can't do anymore and yet somehow you do manage to squeeze out a couple more reps or hold that weight just a little longer.  I thought this dvd was just as intense as Cardio Shred, with more variety in the exercises he has you do.  Some of the moves are not all that difficult but do get your heart rate up as intended.  This also flows smoothly from one exercise to the next, with no rest between, and I think this gives a better workout than when the instructor takes the time to explain the move in infinite detail.  The 4 people working out do a great job, they didn't make it look like it was easy for them, but looked like they felt just like I did!  There is a timer in the bottom corner and it tells you when you have finished a quarter, half and 3/4's of the workout.  I find I look at it quite frequently and it helps to know you are half done, or only have 15 more minutes to go.  Ultimate Cardio Body definitely has high rotation on my dvd playlist.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Def a good cardio work out! Intense HOUR long work out. I am drenched and disguising at the at end. I love it!

reviewText: Bob delivers another hardcore sweat inducing workout.  I have done his Inside Out Series and would say it is on the same level for intermediate to advanced exercisers.  Some of the moves are similar but he also adds some fresh variety.  It was a tough workout but not so hard you cannot complete the sets.  I enjoyed it more than the Inside Out Series as he pushes you hard, however, you change moves before it becomes too intense.  This allows you to maintain good form throughout. There are trailers for upcoming videos that appear to be just as challenging.  Keep them coming Bob.

reviewText: This is an easy to follow video but not an easy workout by any means. This is about one hour of heart racing moves that seems suitable for healthy to fit individuals. Beginners should ease into this with no pressure of following every move. There are some jumping moves with more grounded alternatives. Those with neck, back, or knee problems should consult a physician first but always move slower with more control if you are not sure. Bob does not disappoint if your up for a energy blast.
summary: This is a no joke cardio video- get ready to sweat.

reviewText: I was excited after seeing all the positive reviews, but I was very disappointed upon actually doing the DVD. I am 25 with no knee problems and I work out 6x/week. This DVD KILLED my knees (in the first ten minutes no less!). Plus its extremely BORING! Imagine doing two minutes of lunges followed by two minutes of squats, followed by two minutes of another tedious exercise, on and on and on ad infinitum! I love working out! I HATE this DVD! If you have even a HINT of knee problems, stay far far away!

reviewText: This is a cardio interval style workout that is very similar to cardio conditioning and pure burn super strength (earlier workouts in this series).  This workout is targeted towards intermediate/advanced and uses a combination of cardoi-intensive weight moves (think squats with weights), plyometrics, and high-intensity cardio moves.  This workout uses a lot of high-impact moves but they do provide good modifications to make them lower impact.  There are a lot of squats and lunges so if these bother you, you may want to look elsewhere.  The workout is designed to continually cycle you through high intensity (raise the heart rate) and lower intensity moves so your heart rate is continuously going up and down-mine certainly did!Overall, this is a very tough workout that I think hangs together a bit better than cardio conditioning and pure burn super strength although I would rate the difficulty level as slightly below these two earlier releases (although this is still a very difficult workout).  This works every muscle in the body and I was dripping sweat at the end.  Cueing is done well and attention is given to proper form.  Like earlier workouts, the on-screen timer was present.  The only minor fault I noticed was that in a couple of spots, more work was done on one side of the body than the other.  I definitely liked this workout and I think this would appeal to anyone who likes Bob's earlier Inside-out method workouts, Jari Love, Jillian Michaels, and Jackie Warner.

reviewText: I did this for the first time this morning and really liked it.  There were a couple of times where I said "UGGGH BOB" when the squats and high knees sequences started up AGAIN but all in all I give it five stars because it's a really hard and thorough workout.  I was really distracted by Bob's socks though and laughed out loud during the cool down when he brought them up.  I find him to be so motivating and the time went by really quickly.  I recommend this DVD to anyone who wants a great hour-long workout with an extremely motivating instructor and 'real' people working out alongside him.

reviewText: As an avid follower of Bob I had to get this!  Here is a breakdown of the exercises:Warm UpAlternating LungesSuitcase Swings with SquatSquat with HopHold SquatClean and Press (squat, stand, shoulder press)Front KicksOverhead PressAlternating LungesSplit Lunges (jumping lunges)Bicep CurlsFront Punches (with weights)Alternating LungesSplit LungesWide Bicep CurlsWide Punches (with weights)High Knees10 PushupsStep OversStep UndersHigh Knees10 PushupsStep OversStep UndersSpeed SkatersAlternating RowsLateral RaisesWeighted SquatsWeighted Plyo SquatsAlternating Shoulder PressAlternating Chest PressWeighted SquatsPlyo SquatsAlternating Front RaiseIsometric Raise and HoldAss BurnersSumo SquatsRunner's Lunge PushupsMountain ClimbersHigh KneesRun in PlaceRunner's Lunge PushupsPlankMountain ClimbersTricep KickbacksTricep ExtensionsSingle Leg BalanceSingle Leg HopsJumpsSingle Leg HopsJumpsRun in PlaceSprintJumpsPrisoner SquatsStanding Oblique CrunchesCooldown and StretchOverall a very good cardio/strength workout!  As someone who can do 98% of Bob's "inside out method" with all advanced moves, this Ultimate Cardio Body seemed a little easy (that's why I gave 4 stars).  But Bob keeps it light and fun for us.  And how can you dislike his socks? :D
summary: Could be more intense...but love the socks!!

reviewText: "Bob Harper: Ultimate Cardio Body"  contains two workout programs, the "Extreme Cardio Challenge" and the "10-Minute Glute Challenge".  Both are hard and intense.The "Extreme Cardio Challenge" is an hour and two minutes.Warm up is about 3 minutes of stretches.Cool down is about 2 & a half minutes of stretches.Work out is about 56 & a half minutes.Light to moderate weights are used in about half of the workout, breaks are almost minimal, and there's some high impact moves.The workout was a little too long and difficult for me.Here's a sampling of most of the exercises.Alternating lungeAlternating lunge with pass throughAlternating lunge with extensionSuitcase swing with squatCenter weight squatSquat with hopHold squatClean and pressOverhead pressHigh kneeFront kickOverhead pressAlternating lungeSplit lungeBiceps curlFront punchAlternating lungeSplit lungeBiceps curlWide biceps curlHigh kneePushupStep overStep underHigh kneePush upStep overStep underJumping jackSpeed skateAlternating rowLateral raiseSquatSquat plyoHold squatAlternating shoulder pressAlternating chest pressSquatPlyo squatHold squatAlternating front raiseIsometric raise and holdBurnersSumo squatRunner's lunge pushupMountain climberHigh kneeRun in placeRunner's lunge pushupPlankMountain climberDeep breath relaxationTriceps kickbackTriceps extensionSingle leg balanceSingle leg hopJumpSingle leg side hopJumpRun in placeSprintJumpPrisoner squatStanding oblique crunchThe bonus workout is the "10-minute Glute Challenge."  This little workout is just as tough as the first workout and is about 13 minutes long.  All work is done standing and no weights are used.  Here are the movements.LungeSide lungeFront-side-back lungeBurnerSingle leg hamstring curlSingle leg squatStretchLunge, other legBack lunge, other legSide lunge, other legFront-side-back lunge, other legBurner, other legSingle leg squat, other legSingle leg hamstring curl, other legChair poseCool down/Stretches
summary: One long workout & one short workout, both intense
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is my third Bob Harper video and my second of his cardio routines. And like his "Body Rev Cardio Conditioning" video, this is a serious workout that will have even the most athletic of people covered in sweat by the end.Once again, Bob mixes traditional cardio (jumping jacks, wind sprints, etc) with unorthodox moves and dumbbell training. You know it's a tough routine when you see those very fit people he chooses to demonstrate the routine stopping and gasping for air. I'm a P90X grad, and anyone familiar with that program knows how tough it is and how good of shape it gets you in. But even so, I have to stop and catch my breath at least 2-3 times during this video.Again, this is not for newbies. If you are not in fairly good shape already, then you will find this program pretty tough. I personally wouldn't recommend starting with this, unless you are planning on doing just a little in the beginning and then adding to it gradually. Also, your heart rate gets REALLY elevated doing this routine. So if you do decide to do this, make sure you have your doctor's approval.Aside from that warning, though, I can't find anything negative at all to say about this video. If you're looking for a fun, challenging and effective routine, I can't imagine you would find one much better than this.
summary: Another great Bob Harper cardio routine

reviewText: I bought this DVD with some hesitancy because Bob always looks like the "easier" trainer in comparison to Jillian on The Biggest Loser. However, I was tired of Jillian's routines and wanted to try something new.OMG, this DVD was a killer and did NOT disappoint! I consider myself to be in pretty good shape- I eat very clean, exercise 5x a week (always changing it up too- as they say, "Change creates change"), and try to push myself the majority of the time. Even so, this workout kicked my booty! I found myself sweating, panting, and cursing Bob Harper for making such a tough workout!Bob does circuit training throughout the video: weighted lunges, weighted squats, plyometrics, push ups, mountain climbers, etc. I think this is definitely better Cardio than running on the treadmill/track for an hour, and you'll definitely see results!
summary: Prepare to lose some fat, sweat and tears!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was my first Bob Harper DVD and it won't be my last.  I exercise regularly and was dripping in sweat after this workout and my quads are sore today.  There were several things I liked about this DVD.....The time clock in the lower screen, it helped me track how far I had gone and how much time was left.  This especially helped after the first 30 minutes, I thought to myself, I have only 30 more minutes to go as the clocked ticked down.  I also liked the fact that all the moves were not complicated, I never felt uncoordinated or out of place.  Each move was hard, but easy to do at the same time.  I also enjoyed Bob's personality, he was encouraging and motivating.  I highly recommend this DVD, you will feel the burn.
summary: Try Bob Harper, you won't regret it!
